wikipedia_page.main: George Simpson Carruthers (1 February 1879 – 29 June 1949) was an Australian politician. Born in Lancaster, England, he was elected to the Tasmanian House of Assembly in 1934 as an Independent member for Denison. He held the seat until 1937, when he was defeated. Carruthers died in 1949 at Hobart.

response: * Video clip highlighting Dr. George Carruthers' distinguished career as a space scientist
*Oral History of George Carruthers, conducted in 1992 by the American Institute of Physics

Labor regained much of their ground in the 1934 election, winning 14 seats compared to the Nationalists' 13 (although the Nationalists had received more votes), not enough to govern in a majority. Three seats were won by Independent candidates, and it was only through the support of one of these (George Carruthers, an ex-Labor man and proponent of the Douglasite Social Credit concept), that Labor was able to form government, with Ogilvie as Premier.

Candidates of the 1937 Tasmanian state election
response: Six seats were up for election. The Labor Party was defending three seats. The Nationalist Party was defending two seats. Independent MHA George Carruthers was defending one seat.
